label: Location API
info:
# Meraki Location Scanning API 

This flow demonstrates the basic mechanics of
the Scanning API web service. It will provide
two API endpoints to interact with the Meraki API.

`[get] /scanning`
Responds to Meraki with the `validator` to 
validate the receiver.

`[post] /scanning`
Receives observation data from a Meraki AP. 
The data is compared against the `secret` to
validate the sender.

A **link** node is then used to demonstrate how the
data can be analyzed and routed. 

It is now up to you to do something awesome with
this information. Add a map, database or IoT
control...

http://developers.meraki.com
http://www.InternetOfLEGO.com

label: Captive Portal
info:
# Meraki External Captive Portal (ExCap)

This flow demonstrates the mechanics of working
with the Meraki Captive Portal API. 

There are two "Splash Page" types with Meraki, 
**Click-through** and **Sign on**.

There are two flows to highlight the differences
but they may share common assets, such as a ToS.

# Overview

## Click-through
The click-through splash page simply expects
to receive a request from Meraki which includes
the parameters of the authenticating client. It
will then parse the parameters, present a splash
page and eventually redirect the client to 
the `base_grant_url` once the form is submitted

`[get] /excapClick`
The path Meraki will use as the **Custom Splash 
URL**
The client will see the splash page, which is 
provided by the **HTML (template)** node.

`[post] /excapClickLogin`
The URL that will be the web form's "Action".
It will then send the user form data to the flow
and redirect the client to the `base_grant_url`.


## Sign On

`[get] /excapSignOn`
The path Meraki will use as the **Custom Splash
URL**
The client will see the splash page, which is 
provided by the **HTML (template)** node.
The form will include a Meraki provided `login_url`, which will
be set as the "Action" on the web form.

`[post] /excapSuccess`
This path Meraki will use as the continue_url
for the client once they have succesfully logged
in. Use this to have a final interaction with the
client.


# Usage

Login to Meraki Dashboard and configure the 
custom Splash Page URL to one of these methods.
* http://yourserver:1880/excapClick
* http://yourserver:1880/excapSignOn

If using Sign On, you must also configure WiFi 
User accounts that are authorized for the SSID.

# More Info

https://meraki.cisco.com/lib/pdf/meraki_whitepaper_captive_portal.pdf
http://developers.meraki.com
http://www.InternetOfLEGO.com

label: Dashboard API - Admin Form
info:
# Dashboard API - Admin Form
A flow to create and administrator for a
Meraki network. 

## Configure
* Update the Environment Variables node
**Env Variables: UPDATE THIS**

Your API KEY (Keep this secret. Do not publish)
```
const API_KEY = 'YourAPIKey'; 
```

Your Shard number. https://n149.meraki.com , 
where n149 represent the shard number. 
You can see this URL when you login to your Meraki Dashboard.
This is defined to avoid redirect issues.
```
var shard = 'n149'; 
```
Your Default Organization ID (optional)
```
var orgId = ''; 
```

# Usage

`[get /meraki/admins]`
Presents the web form.

Navigate to
* http://localhost:1880/meraki/admins


# Verify
If the user was created properly, the web page
will display the committed details. You can
verify the account in the Meraki Dashboard

# More Info

http://developers.meraki.com
http://www.InternetOfLEGO.com









This flow can be adjusted to
leaverage the many other API endpoints available.

label: Cisco Spark
info:
# Cisco Spark API Demo
Collects data from **input** nodes and sends it
to a Spark room.

# Configure
Update the **function** node "Spark Send Message (API) - UPDATE"
* Set Your Variables
**Your Access Token**
```
var accessToken = "EnterYourAccessTokenHere";
```
**Your Room ID**
```
var roomId = "EnterYourRoomIDHere";
```

# Usage
The link nodes from other flows can be sent to 
the "Cisco Spark" **link in* node. As messages
arrive, they will be sent to the Spark room. The
messages will typically be formatted before sending
to adjust for the Spark message room layout.

# More Info

Learn about getting an accessToken and using their 
online API console to obtain the roomId.
https://developer.ciscospark.com/

https://developer.ciscospark.com/

validate-validator - UPDATE
validate-secret - UPDATE
Meraki Location API - Using Native Nodes -- README
info:
This flow demonstrates how to interact with the
Meraki CMX (Scanning) Location API.

# Be sure to update the validator and secret

The "CMX core functions" consist of two REST endpoints.
The 'get' enpoint waits to hear from Meraki,
which will send a request to this server. The flow will 
then respond with the "validator", which was defined in 
the Meraki Dashboard. If the correct validator is returned, 
Meraki has confirmed that it is sending location data to 
the correct server.

The second enpoint accepts 'post' requests, which will
be receiving the JSON structured location data from Meraki.

Once the data has arrived in the `msg.payload`, the results
will be stored in a local MongoDB database if the supplied secret
matches what's defined in the global variables. This is to ensure
that it is in fact Meraki sending this data. 

The data can then be retrieved by opening the other 'get' endpoints, such 
as /showcmxNative.

name: HTML Login Page
template:
{{{payload.css}}} Registration Form

Login to WiFi

Your IP: {{payload.client_ip}}
Your MAC: {{payload.client_mac}}

name: Set login_url
func:
msg.payload.login_url = msg.payload.base_grant_url + '?continue_url=' + msg.payload.user_continue_url;

return msg;

name: Meraki Click-through, read more...
info:
Configure by placing this host server address
followed by /excapClick in the Custom Splash Page URL
section of the Meraki Dashboard.

ie. https://yourserver:1880/excapClick

Be sure to update the "walled garden" in the 
Meraki Dashboard with the IP address of your 
server and any other resources required before
login, such as your website, images, CSS, etc.

The HTML page can be modified as needed.

name: Meraki Sign-on, read more...
info:
Configure by placing this host server address
followed by /excapClick in the Custom Splash Page URL
section of the Meraki Dashboard.

ie. https://yourserver:1880/excapSignOn

Be sure to update the "walled garden" in the 
Meraki Dashboard with the IP address of your 
server and any other resources required before
login, such as your website, images, CSS, etc.

The login data now can be sent somehwere to be 
logged. A link node is attached to easily use
this data in other parts of the flow.

  • Your computer's MAC and IP address will be logged.

name: CSS Style
template:
<style>
html{
    background-color: #f3f3f3;
}

.form-register{
    max-width: 1000px;
    width: 100%;
    margin: 0 auto;

    font: bold 14px sans-serif;
    text-align: center;
}

.form-register-with-email{
    position: relative;
    display: inline-block;
    vertical-align: top;
    margin-right: 130px;
    text-align: center;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-white-background{
    width: 570px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    background-color: #ffffff;
    box-shadow: 0 1px 3px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    padding: 60px 80px;
    margin-bottom: 35px;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-row{
    text-align: left;
    margin-bottom: 23px;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-title-row{
    text-align: center;
    margin-bottom: 50px;
}

.form-register-with-email h1{
    display: inline-block;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    color:  #4c565e;
    font-size: 24px;
    padding: 0 20px 15px;
    border-bottom: 2px solid #6caee0;
    margin: 0;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-row > label span{
    display: inline-block;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    color:  #5f5f5f;
    width: 125px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 25px;
}

.form-register-with-email input{
    color:  #5f5f5f;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    width: 230px;
    box-shadow: 1px 2px 4px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08);
    padding: 12px 18px;
    border: 1px solid #dbdbdb;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-checkbox input{
    margin-left: 128px;
    margin-right: 10px;
    width: auto;
    vertical-align: top;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-row .form-checkbox span{
    font-size: 12px;
    font-weight: normal;
    display: inline-block;
    text-align: left;
    width: 220px;
    margin: 0;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-checkbox span a{
    text-decoration: none;
    color:  #6caee0;
}

.form-register-with-email button{
    display: block;
    border-radius: 2px;
    background-color:  #6caee0;
    color: #ffffff;
    font-weight: bold;
    box-shadow: 1px 2px 4px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08);
    padding: 15px 35px;
    border: 0;
    margin: 55px auto 0;
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-register-with-email .form-log-in-with-existing{
    text-decoration: none;
    padding: 4px 8px;
    font-weight: normal;
    color: #7b9d62;
    background-color: #d6f0c3;
}


.form-sign-in-with-social{
    display: inline-block;
    max-width: 180px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    vertical-align: top;
    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 100px;
}

.form-sign-in-with-social .form-title-row{
    margin-bottom: 50px;
}

.form-sign-in-with-social .form-title{
    box-sizing: border-box;
    color:  #4c565e;
    font-size: 24px;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border-bottom: 2px solid #6caee0;
}

.form-sign-in-with-social .form-google-button{
    color:  #ffffff;
    display: block;
    width: 145px;
    height: 40px;
    font-size: 12px;
    line-height: 40px;
    background-color:  rgba(222, 110, 60, 0.9);
    box-shadow: 1px 2px 2px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08);
    border-radius: 2px;
    margin: 8px auto;
    text-decoration: none;
}

.form-sign-in-with-social .form-facebook-button{
    color:  #ffffff;
    display: block;
    width: 145px;
    height: 40px;
    font-size: 12px;
    line-height: 40px;
    background-color:  rgba(75, 136, 194, 0.9);
    box-shadow: 1px 2px 2px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08);
    border-radius: 2px;
    margin: 8px auto;
    text-decoration: none;
}

.form-sign-in-with-social .form-twitter-button{
    color:  #ffffff;
    display: block;
    width: 145px;
    height: 40px;
    font-size: 12px;
    line-height: 40px;
    background-color:  rgba(123, 195, 226, 0.9);
    box-shadow: 1px 2px 2px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08);
    border-radius: 2px;
    margin: 8px auto;
    text-decoration: none;
}

/*	Making the form responsive. Remove these media queries
    if you don't need the form to work on mobile devices. */

@media (max-width: 900px) {

    .form-register{
        margin: 20px auto;
    }

    .form-register-with-email{
        position: relative;
        display: block;
        margin: 0;
    }

    .form-register-with-email .form-white-background{
        margin: 0 auto 32px;
    }



    .form-sign-in-with-social {
        margin-top: 105px;
    }

}

@media (max-width: 600px) {

    .form-register-with-email .form-white-background{
        width: 300px;
        padding-left: 35px;
        padding-right: 35px;
    }

    .form-register-with-email .form-row > label span{
        display: block;
        text-align: left;
        padding: 0 0 10px;
    }

    .form-register-with-email input{
        display: block;
        margin: 0 auto;
    }

    .form-register-with-email .form-checkbox input{
        display: inline-block;
        margin-left: 0;
    }

    .form-register-with-email .form-checkbox span{
        width: 200px !important;
    }

    .form-register-with-email:after{
        bottom: -80px;
        left: 50%;
        margin-left: -25px;
    }

}
</style>

name: Meraki API - List Organizations

Env Variables: UPDATE THIS
Meraki API - Create Admin
Spark Send Message (API) - UPDATE
Cisco Spark API Examples - README
info:
These sample flows simply take the results from
the linked sample flows, formats them and sends a message
to a Cisco Spark room.

Update the Spark API function with your `roomID`
and your `accessToken`. These can be found on 
the developers portal for Cisco Spark.

The `accessToken` can be found in the portal by
clicking on your profile icon in the top right.
Copy this token into the function variable.

Example Token
`ZGJjNzI0ODAtNmEwNS00YjU3LTkzOTYtMjthisisbogushmOWI3M2IyZGI4NzctZDVh`

*API to List Rooms*
https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-rooms-get.html
- you will get your roomId by running this call
using their "Test Mode", which will run the command
and the resulting JSON will appear with the 
id, name, etc. Copy the `id` value into the function variable.
`
{
			"id": "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vNWExMjhhNTAtNTExZi0xMWU3LTk2NTctYjMzNWEyNmMzYmVj",
			"title": "Node-RED Testing Sandbox",
			"type": "group",
			"isLocked": false,
			"lastActivity": "2017-06-14T20:21:09.726Z",
			"creatorId": "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1BFT1BMRS80ZjY4OWNhZS1mYjNlLTRjNDEtODM3OC1hYmY1Mjc2Y2RmMzQ",
			"created": "2017-06-14T16:34:35.509Z"
		}
`

*API to Send a Message*
https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-messages-post.html
